quiz.title: Algebra 2: Unit 11 Quiz 10
quiz.subtitle: 11.10: Modeling with Trigonometric Functions
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Creating functions from real-world periodic data

questions.question: An oceanographer measures the tide. The high tide is $12$ feet and the low tide is $2$ feet. What is the midline ($k$) of the trigonometric model?
questions.explanation: The midline is the average of the max and min: $(12 + 2) / 2 = 7$.

questions.question: Using the same tide data (Max: $12$ ft, Min: $2$ ft), what is the amplitude ($a$) of the model?
questions.explanation: Amplitude is the distance from the midline to the max: $12 - 7 = 5$ feet (or $(12-2)/2$).

questions.question: A Ferris wheel ticket costs \$15. The wheel has a diameter of $40$ meters and the bottom of the wheel is $2$ meters off the ground. What is the maximum height reached by a rider?
questions.explanation: Max height = Diameter + Height of bottom. $40 + 2 = 42$ meters.

questions.question: The temperature in a city fluctuates between $60^{\circ}$F and $90^{\circ}$F every $24$ hours. If $t=0$ represents midnight and the low temperature occurs at midnight, which function best models this using a negative cosine graph?
questions.explanation: Midline = 75, Amplitude = 15. Period = 24, so $b = 2\pi/24 = \pi/12$. A negative cosine starts at the minimum.

questions.question: A student pays \$25 for a dataset showing that a buoy completes a full cycle every $10$ seconds. What is the value of $b$ for the model?
A predator-prey model shows the population of rabbits oscillating between $100$ and $500$. What is the amplitude of this function?
A specialized sound level meter costs \$120. It records a wave that starts at its midline at $t=0$ and goes up. Which parent function is the easiest to use for this model?
questions.explanation: The sine function naturally starts at $(0,0)$ on the midline and moves in a positive direction.

questions.question: A person's blood pressure is modeled by $P(t) = 20\sin(160\pi t) + 100$. What is the 'systolic' (maximum) blood pressure?
A Ferris wheel completes one revolution every $60$ seconds. If a rider starts at the very bottom ($2$ meters) at $t=0$, and the midline is $22$ meters, what is the height at $t=15$ seconds?
questions.explanation: At 15 seconds, the rider has completed 1/4 of the cycle. 1/4 of a cycle from the bottom puts the rider exactly at the midline (22 meters).

questions.question: A research grant costs \$5,000 to study a light signal that flashes every $0.2$ seconds. What is the frequency in flashes per second (Hz)?
